Statistic Computation (stats.py)¶

Main script for computation of all the statistics. Appreciation goes to Baseball Stats CZ for help and explanation with different statistics and equations.

local.stats.A(df)[source]¶

Number of assists. Available for field players.

Parameters:df – Pandas Dataframe containing parsed csv with data.
Returns:Pandas Series with given statistics, for each player. NAN values are substituted for 0.
local.stats.AB(df)[source]¶

At bat, doesn’t count sacrifice, walks and hit by pitch. Available for pitchers and batters.

Parameters:df – Pandas Dataframe containing parsed csv with data.
Returns:Pandas Series with given statistics, for each player.
local.stats.BA(df)[source]¶

Batting average for batters and pitchers.

Parameters:df – Pandas Dataframe containing parsed csv with data.
Returns:Pandas Series with given statistics, for each player.
local.stats.BAA(df)[source]¶

Batting average against. Available to pitchers.

Parameters:df – Pandas Dataframe containing parsed csv with data.
Returns:Pandas Series with given statistics, for each player. NAN values are substituted for 0.
local.stats.BABIP(df)[source]¶

Batting average on balls in play. Available for batters.

Parameters:df – Pandas Dataframe containing parsed csv with data.
Returns:Pandas Series with given statistics, for each player. NAN values are substituted for 0.
local.stats.BB(df)[source]¶

Bases on balls, free bases given to opponent batters. Available for pitchers.

Parameters:df – Pandas Dataframe containing parsed csv with data.
Returns:Pandas Series with given statistics, for each player. NAN values are substituted for 0.
local.stats.BB9(df)[source]¶

Bases on balls per 9 innings. Available for pitchers.

Parameters:df – Pandas Dataframe containing parsed csv with data.
Returns:Pandas Series with given statistics, for each player. NAN values are substituted for 0.

Percentage of free bases to plate appearances. Available for batters.

Parameters:df – Pandas Dataframe containing parsed csv with data.
Returns:Pandas Series with given statistics, for each player. NAN values are substituted for 0.

Returns:Pandas Series with given statistics, for each player. NAN values are substituted for 0.

Returns:Pandas Series with given statistics, for each player. NAN values are substituted for 0.
local.stats.CS(df)[source]¶

Number of times caught stealing base for batters, or number of players caught stealing for catchers.

Parameters:df – Pandas Dataframe containing parsed csv with data.
Returns:Pandas Series with given statistics, for each player.
local.stats.CSA(df)[source]¶

Caught stealing average, shown as fraction, e.g., 0.97. Available for catchers.

Parameters:df – Pandas Dataframe containing parsed csv with data.
Returns:Pandas Series with given statistics, for each player. NAN values are substituted for 0.

Returns:Pandas Series with given statistics, for each player. NAN values are substituted for 0.

Returns:Pandas Series with given statistics, for each player. NAN values are substituted for 0.
local.stats.FIP(df, min_ip)[source]¶

Fielding independent pitching. Available for pitchers.

Parameters:
  • df – Pandas Dataframe containing parsed csv with data.
  • min_pa – Minimal number of plate appearances(PA). All players with smaller number of PA will be neglected from computation
Returns:

Pandas Series with given statistics, for each player. NAN values are substituted for 0.
local.stats.FIP_minus(df, min_ip)[source]¶

FIP through percentage, 100.0 is league average. Available for pitchers.

Parameters:
  • df – Pandas Dataframe containing parsed csv with data.
  • min_pa – Minimal number of plate appearances(PA). All players with smaller number of PA will be neglected from computation
Returns:

Pandas Series with given statistics, for each player. NAN values are substituted for 0.

Returns:Pandas Series with given statistics, for each player.

Returns:Pandas Series with given statistics, for each player.

Returns:Pandas Series with given statistics, for each player.

local.stats.ISO(df, min_pa)[source]¶

Parameters:df – Pandas Dataframe containing parsed csv with data.
Returns:Pandas Series with given statistics, for each player.

Returns:Pandas Series with given statistics, for each player.

Returns:Pandas Series with given statistics, for each player.

Returns:Pandas Series with given statistics, for each player. NAN values are substituted for 0.

Returns:Pandas Series with given statistics, for each player. NAN values are substituted for 0.
local.stats.WPA(df)[source]¶

Wild pitches average, number of wild pitches per 9 innings. Available for pitchers.

Parameters:df – Pandas Dataframe containing parsed csv with data.
Returns:Pandas Series with given statistics, for each player. NAN values are substituted for 0.
local.stats.XBH(df)[source]¶

Number of extra base hits for batters, or number of extra base hits allowed for pitchers.

Parameters:df – Pandas Dataframe containing parsed csv with data.
Returns:Pandas Series with given statistics, for each player.
local.stats.change_type(data, t)[source]¶

Change type of the Series to given type. All ‘,’ are changed to ‘.’ and all ‘%’ are erased to work with statistic computation.

Parameters:
  • data – Series to change the type of.
  • t – Type to change to.
Returns:

Series with type changed to t.
local.stats.double(df)[source]¶

Number of double hits for batters, or number of doubles allowed for pitchers.

Parameters:df – Pandas Dataframe containing parsed csv with data.
Returns:Pandas Series with given statistics, for each player.
local.stats.nan_to_zero(data)[source]¶

Change all NaN values to 0.

Parameters:data – Data where the NaN values should be swapped.
Returns:Data with NaN values swapped for 0.
local.stats.remove_nan(data)[source]¶

Remove all NaN values from data.

Parameters:data – Data to remove NaN values from.
Returns:Data with NaN values removed.
local.stats.single(df)[source]¶

Number of single hits for batters, or number of singles allowed for pitchers.

Parameters:df – Pandas Dataframe containing parsed csv with data.
Returns:Pandas Series with given statistics, for each player.
local.stats.sort_computed_data(df, computed_data, ascending=False)[source]¶

Sort computed data values and connect them with the names from Dataframe df.

Parameters:
  • df – Pandas Dataframe containing parsed csv with data.
  • computed_data – Series with computed data, such as those coming out of statistic functions.
  • ascending – Whether to sort data in the ascending order on not.
Returns:

Pandas Dataframe with computed_data sorted and joined with the names of players.
local.stats.triple(df)[source]¶

Number of triple hits for batters, or number of triples allowed for pitchers.

Parameters:df – Pandas Dataframe containing parsed csv with data.
Returns:Pandas Series with given statistics, for each player.
local.stats.wOBA(df, min_pa)[source]¶

Weighted on-base average. Can be adjusted to be computed only for players with certain number on plate appearances.

Parameters:
  • df – Pandas Dataframe containing parsed csv with data.
  • min_pa – Minimal number of plate appearances(PA). All players with smaller number of PA will be neglected from computation
Returns:

Pandas Series with given statistics, for each player. NAN values are substituted for 0.
local.stats.wRC(df, min_pa)[source]¶

Weighted runs created. Available for batters.

Parameters:
  • df – Pandas Dataframe containing parsed csv with data.
  • min_pa – Minimal number of plate appearances(PA). All players with smaller number of PA will be neglected from computation
Returns:

Pandas Series with given statistics, for each player. NAN values are substituted for 0.
local.stats.wRC_plus(df, min_pa)[source]¶

Weighted run created plus. 100.0 is league average. Available for batters.

Parameters:
  • df – Pandas Dataframe containing parsed csv with data.
  • min_pa – Minimal number of plate appearances(PA). All players with smaller number of PA will be neglected from computation
Returns:

Pandas Series with given statistics, for each player. NAN values are substituted for 0.
